GridConnectivity#

Module Contents#

Classes#

GridConnectivity

This class constructs the connectivity matrix for the oscillatory network.
class GridConnectivity.GridConnectivity(nr_neurons, nr_ping_networks)#

This class constructs the connectivity matrix for the oscillatory network.

The interaction strength of lateral connections is represented by a matrix \(K\) of pairwise coupling weights defined by an exponential function decaying by the Euclidean distance between the PING networks they belong to:

\(K_{v, w} = C_{ \mathsf{type}(v), \mathsf{type}(w)} \exp (-\| \mathsf{loc}(v), \mathsf{loc}(w) \| / s_{v, w}),\)

where

  • \(v, w\) are two arbitrary neurons in the network,

  • \(\mathsf{type}(v)\) maps a neuron to its type (see NeuronTypes),

  • \(\mathsf{loc}(v)\) maps a neuron to its location on the grid,

  • \(s_{v, w}\) is the spatial constant (see constants.SPATIAL_CONST).

This equation was introduced in [Izhikevich, 2003].

This class performs the assignment of neurons to relevant PING networks arranged in a grid and computes the matrix of coupling weights.

Parameters

  • nr_neurons (dict[NeuronTypes: int]) – number of neurons of each type in the network.

  • nr_ping_networks (int) – number of PING networks in the network.

Raises

AssertionError: If the number of PING networks is smaller than 1.

Raises

AssertionError: if number of excitatory neurons doesn’t divide the number of PING networks as there should be an equal number of excitatory neurons in each PING network.

Raises

AssertionError: if number of inhibitory neurons doesn’t divide the number of PING networks as there should be an equal number of inhibitory neurons in each PING network.

Raises

AssertionError: if the number of PING networks is not a square as PING networks should be arranged in a square grid.

Variables

  • _nr_neurons – number of neurons of each type in the network.

  • _nr_ping_networks – number of ping_networks in the network.

  • coupling_weights – Matrix of all coupling weights.

_assign_ping_networks(self)#

Creates PING networks, assigns grid locations to them, and adds the same number of neurons of each neuron type to them.

In other words, this function creates a map that can be used as function \(\mathsf{loc}\).

Returns

list of PING networks in the network and a dictionary mapping a neuron to the PING network it belongs to.

Return type

tuple[list[PINGNetwork], dict[NeuronTypes: dict[int, int]]]

_compute_coupling_weights(self, ping_networks, neuron_ping_map)#

Computes the coupling weights between all neurons.

Essentially, this method computes the full matrix \(K\) of coupling weights.

Parameters

  • ping_networks (list[PINGNetwork]) – list of PING networks in the network.

  • neuron_ping_map (dict[NeuronTypes: dict[int, int]]) – a dictionary mapping a neuron to the PING network it belongs to.

Returns

matrix of all coupling weights.

Return type

ndarray[ndarray[float]]

_get_neurons_dist(self, neuron_type1, neuron_type2, nr1, nr2, ping_networks, neuron_ping_map)#

Computes the matrix of Euclidian distances between two types of neurons.

This method computes a matrix of \(\| \mathsf{loc}(v), \mathsf{loc}(w) \|\) between neurons \(v\) and \(w\) of given types.

Parameters

  • neuron_type1 (NeuronTypes) – neurons neuron_type 1

  • neuron_type2 (NeuronTypes) – neurons neuron_type 2

  • nr1 (int) – number of neurons of neuron_type 1

  • nr2 (int) – number of neurons of neuron_type 2

  • ping_networks (list[PINGNetwork]) – list of PING networks in the network.

  • neuron_ping_map (dict[NeuronTypes: dict[int, int]]) – a dictionary mapping a neuron to the PING network it belongs to.

Returns

The matrix nr1 x nr2 of pairwise distances between neurons.

Return type

list[list[float]]

_compute_type_coupling_weights(self, dist, max_connect_strength, spatial_const)#

Computes the coupling weights for connections between two types of neurons.

This method computes a matrix of \(K_{v, w}\) between neurons \(v\) and \(w\) of given types.

Parameters

  • dist (list[list[float]]) – distance matrix with pairwise distances between neurons.

  • max_connect_strength (float) – max connection strength between neuron types.

  • spatial_const (float) – spatial constant for the neuron types.

Returns

the matrix of coupling weights of size nr1 x nr2, where n1 and nr2 - number of neurons of each neuron_type in the coupling of interest.

Return type

list[list[float]]
